alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 2:14PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 213 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Colorado Springs, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Woodland Park, Monument, Air Force Academy, Manitou Springs, Green Mountain Falls, Crystola, Security, Falcon, Divide, Stratmoor, Chipita Park, Gleneagle, Fort Carson, Peterson AFB, Cimarron Hills, Cascade and Security-Widefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
